title: Turkey - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: TTB: Turkish Medical Association; Health Workers (Turkey); KESK: Confederation of Public Workers Unions; TMMOB: Union of Chambers of Turkish Engineers and Architects; Labour Group (Turkey); Lawyers (Turkey); Egitim Sen: Education and Science Workers Union; Teachers (Turkey)
ANF News; Haber Ercis; Mezopotamya Agency

On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was staged in Seyhan town center, Adana in solidarity with the protests of Bogazici University students in Istanbul against the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a government decree. KESK, TTB, TMMOB, Adana Bar Association lawyers and Egitim-Sen supported the event. Police intervened and detained 10 protesters. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, a demonstration was held in Kizilay area of Cankaya town center, Ankara in solidarity with the demonstrations held by the Bogazici University students in Istanbul protesting the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a presidential decree. Police intervened in the event with tear gas and rubber bullets, and detained 30 protesters. [size=no event]

Security measures: On 5 February 2021, Adana Governor's Office issued a ban on all forms of marches, protests, press conferences, sit-ins and other political gatherings in the province for 15 days as part of the measures to curb the coronavirus outbreak.
Muslim Group (Turkey); TUGVA: Turkish Youth Foundation; Government of Turkey (2016-)

On 5 February 2021, a Muslim group including TUGVA members held a demonstration outside the Ulu mosque in Osmangazi, Bursa following the morning prayer they held, to oppose the protests held by Bogazici university students and express support for police forces and the state against the protesters. Mayor of Bursa also attended the event. [size=no report]
Muslim Group (Turkey); TUGVA: Turkish Youth Foundation

On 5 February 2021, a Muslim group including TUGVA members held a demonstration outside the Hatuniye mosque in Manisa town following the Friday prayer they held, to oppose the protests held by Bogazici university students and express support for police forces and the state against the protesters. [size=no report]

Security measures: On 5 February 2021, Kirklareli Governor's Office issued a ban on all forms of marches, protests, press conferences, sit-ins and other political gatherings in the province for 30 days as part of the measures to curb the coronavirus outbreak.
Arrests: Around 5 February 2021 (as reported), 52 Afghan migrants who entered Turkey illegally were detained by the police forces in the central district, Kars.

On 5 February 2021, workers staged a demonstration outside the management building of a supermarket chain in Umraniye, Istanbul to protest the factory management which allegedly forces workers to take unpaid leaves. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Special Operations; Village Guards
Aydinlik; Ihlas News Agency; TRT Haber

Movement of forces: On 5 February 2021, Turkish Gendarmerie forces launched a ground operation named 'Eren-7' against PKK militants with the deployment of total 1062 personnel in Tunceli province. Special operation units of Police forces and village guards also participated in the operation.

On 5 February 2021, families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK continued their sit-in protest outside the HDP's provincial building in Baglar, Diyarbakir city center. The families accused HDP of working with PKK, and demanded their children be returned. Turkey's minister of commerce attended the event. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, the Middle East Technical University academics held a demonstration at the university's campus in Cankaya, Ankara in solidarity with the demonstrations held by the Bogazici University students in Istanbul protesting the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a presidential decree. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, more than 200 students and academics of the Bogazici university continued their demonstrations outside the administration building at the university's campus in Besiktas, Istanbul in protest of the appointment of a new president via a government decree. [size=more than 200]

On 5 February 2021, TGB members held a demonstration at Beyazit square in Fatih, Istanbul to oppose the protests held by Bogazici university students and express support for police forces and the state. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK held a protest outside the HDP's provincial building in Hakkari city center. The families accused HDP of working with PKK, and demanded their children be returned. [size=no report]
Students (Turkey); HDP: Peoples Democratic Party; Government of Turkey (2016-)
A Haber; Karar; Cumhuriyet; ANF News

On 5 February 2021, university students staged a demonstrations in Konak town center, Izmir in solidarity with the protests of Bogazici University students in Istanbul against the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a government decree. HDP MPs also attended the event. Police intervened and detained 26 protesters. [size=no report]

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Istanbul with 3 reports followed by Adana with 2 reports.
The largest admin2 is Seyhan with 2 reports followed by Cankaya with 2 reports.
The largest admin1 is Istanbul with 2128 reports followed by Diyarbakir with 1588 reports.
The largest admin2 is Cankaya with 1361 reports followed by Diyarbakir with 845 reports.
